title: Hired wrong contractor - rushed decision
whatHappened: Needed installer fast for big project. Skipped reference checks. Hired someone based on 'good vibes.' They no-showed twice, damaged customer's wall, demanded payment upfront. Had to fire them mid-job.
costOpportunity: Lost the customer's trust. They left a bad review (since removed). Almost lost $15K follow-up project.
rootCause: Desperation + no vetting process. I was so focused on 'getting it done' that I skipped basic due diligence.
lessonLearned: NEVER hire under pressure. Better to delay a project than hire the wrong person. Speed = expensive when you skip steps.
systemCreated: Contractor vetting checklist: 1) Check 3 references. 2) Start with small test project. 3) Verify insurance. 4) Check reviews on 3+ platforms. 5) Never pay more than 25% upfront.

title: Overpromised to customer - unrealistic timeline
whatHappened: Customer asked: 'Can you install by Friday?' It was Wednesday. I said yes without checking installer availability. Installer was booked. Had to delay to next week. Customer was upset.
costOpportunity: Damaged trust with high-value customer. They posted on local Facebook group warning others about delays.
rootCause: People-pleasing. Afraid of losing the sale, so I said yes before thinking. Didn't want to disappoint them.
lessonLearned: Under-promise, over-deliver. It's better to say 'Let me check and get back to you' than to promise and fail. Honesty > speed.
systemCreated: New response: 'Great question! Let me confirm with my install team and I'll text you within 2 hours with exact timeline.' Then check calendar, add buffer, give realistic date.

title: Spent $2K on ads without testing
whatHappened: Saw competitor running Facebook ads. Thought 'I should do that too!' Spent $2K on ads without testing copy, images, or targeting. Got 3 leads. None converted. $667 per lead = unsustainable.
costOpportunity: Could have spent that on direct outreach (which actually works for me). Lost momentum and confidence in marketing.
rootCause: Shiny object syndrome. Assumed ads work for everyone. Didn't test assumptions. Impatience - wanted instant results.
lessonLearned: Test cheap before scaling. Start with $100-200 test budget. Validate the channel works BEFORE pouring money in. Not every tactic works for every business.
systemCreated: New rule: Never spend more than $200 on a new marketing channel until I get 3+ conversions. Test small, scale what works.
